This film had a lot of depth of stories in family, relationships, culture, and history.

It's not just a simple romcom. There are several gems of stories that consecutively depict life...just like real life.

Top cast with great locations that took us around the island, through the Mountains and into the stars.

My kids enjoyed the movie as well as my husband. It was comical and profound.

It was so much better than we had anticipated. Even had Bumpy Kànahele and his group. Loved that Kanikapila session. I know this is years later after the film came out but I just wanted people to know it is actually a greatly movie.

review_title: This worked as my wife's fun movie pick
review_detailed_main:
This is a nice amalgam of charming performances, that of Emma Stone and Rachel McAdams, particularly, and the mystique of Hawaii with a minimum plot that mostly serves as a flimsy but inoffensive excuse.

Bradley Cooper who is no slouch is the narrative center of the film with Stone, McAdams and even Bill Murray and Alec Baldwin revolving around his character's actions. Cooper and McAdams both pull out their usual impressive set of moves, but the real delight of the show is Emma Stone, who sparkles impossibly brightly.

When Ms. Stone comes on screen you're immediately reminded of old movies where some perky leading lady momentarily steals the show. That was never a centerpiece in movie's heyday, but Ms Stone is so immediately lovable in this film, that she nearly overwhelms everyone else's performance. And that's worth the price of admission by itself.

review_title: A single word like underrated is not enough to describe this; its brilliant and thought provoking.

review_detailed_main: I really enjoyed this fresh take on the old romcom. The story was unexpected and I enjoyed the multiple layers and story lines
I really enjoyed this movie. Clearly it is underrated.

Another movie that I happened upon while channel surfing. I quickly checked IMDB to check who was in the cast and Aloha has plenty of star power with plenty of A and B listers. Bradley Cooper, Emma Stone, Rachel McAdams, Bill Murray, Alec Baldwin and the list goes on. I believe that most people have a problem with the movie because they were expecting a romcom. While it's not the deepest album ever made, it does have a bunch of subplots and several of them are serious in nature. These subplots are not hard to decipher, but all of the characters give very good performances. I have seen Aloha two more times and I still very much enjoy it.

7 to 8 stars, going with 8.

Don't believe the ratings when it comes to this film. Sure, there are a few inconsistencies here and there regarding the story threads, especially in the first third of the film, but if you can get beyond that and let the story and characters truly unfold, this is a little gem of a film. The acting is really spot on, particularly with Cooper, McAdams, Krasinski, the over-eager but slightly insecure Emma Stone, and the super- talented teenage actress who plays Grace. In fact, the final moments of the film were beautifully acted and embodied the whole spirit of this film. The most powerful feelings often cannot be fully expressed in words; but the power of gestures and in particular the amazing eye contact and non-verbal acting talent in this film, are what truly makes it so satisfying to watch. If you want a heart-satisfying story that mirrors the the complexities of real life, and the emotional layers that are often expressed through the power of gestures (the beautiful Hawaiian dancing comes to mind), then Crowe has served up a truly satisfying feel-good film. I highly recommend it.

review_title: Complex, funny, emotional lost love story with an environmental twist plays well.
review_detailed_main: 1st watched 6/6/2015 Complex, funny, emotional lost love story with an environmental twist plays well. Bradley Cooper plays a contractor getting a gig in Hawaii where he has many connections including an ex-love interest played by Rachel McAdams. He is assigned a tag-along in the project in an Air Force pilot played by Emma Stone(bringing along her usual charm). The project involves getting the blessing from local folk to build on some land for what will be a blossoming contract company for the military. The gig seems like a normal formed alliance with the Hawaiian people, but gets very complex when it's assumed the military has plans that will not make them happy(satellites in orbit with possible weapon deployment in the air). The romantic triangle is the centerpiece but there is so much more here done by writer/director Cameron Crowe in this carefully constructed tale. The storyline definetly doesn't sound like a blockbuster, but the talent involved here brings this piece up another level. A good job by all involved.

review_title: Captain Allison Ng (Emma Stone) and Tracy Woodside (Rachel McAdams)

review_detailed_main: Sure i'm a 72 year old grandmother, & i have seen a bunch of movies in my lifetime. As a teenager my sister & i would stay up late at night on weekends & in the summertime & watch great romantic movies. We would sit right next to the tv so the sound wouldn't bother our parents. Now i can recognize duds & hits. This movie is a sleeper, one filled with intelligent dialogue & talented actors. It's a movie i can watch again & again & not grow tired of it. This movie has surprises with the actors & the plots. I'm a new fan of Bradley Cooper & his blue eyes. Taking place in gorgeous & lush Hawaii is perfect!!! I'll be recommending this to friends & to my sister!!!

Emma Stone are Bradley Cooper shining in this quirky unexpected love story bound up in a triangle of great story telling simply written to uncomplicated an enjoyable saga. Brilliantly casted and excellently written, superbly directed.

There only a few US states that were independent countries before they were appended to the USA;

1) Hawaii - formed in 1795, annexed by USA in 1898. Independent Kingdom

2) Deseret - the independent country of the Mormons from around 1850 until the peace with the USA in 1890 recognising Utah as a state.

3) Texas - 1836-1848. Voted to join USA after Mexican American War.

4) California Republic - existed briefly in 1846 but was subsumed by the USA.

So this film is really about Hawaii, and is full of cultural diversity and inclusion.

Well-scripted and well-acted, it paces well and is very funny.

The film soundtrack is great!

Everyone shines, Bradley Cooper, Rachel McAdams and Emma Stone.

This movie is definitely not worth 10 stars but it most certainly is not worth the 5.4 either. I loved the story and the effect it had on my psyche. As an art form, the film is about stirring up an emotion, making you feel something and this movie achieved that, it had a way of telling the story that I haven't seen before. So critics can take their sticks and to further depths on this one.

The acting was believable and immersive, the music was really good. The whole production achieved its goal to take you on a journey, to live through these characters, to relate to them, to make you ask yourself certain questions and it all came together in a wholesome way.

Was kinda blown away, and remembered Crowe w\Vanilla Sky and Almost Famous. This is not his best but much better than a "5.4". Have good personal connection to this so its an excellent portrayal of all the drama within the military, Agree with all the positive responses, the whole racism bit is non-sense and alot of this film is about outside the Military, Would recommend this because Crowe definitely captures some of the odd things in a military and a romantic life.... Rf.
